name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Petitioner v. Michael COOPER, Respondent

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Petitioner v. Michael COOPER, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 29th day of December, 2009, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED. The issue, rephrased for clai'ity, is:
Are the Superior Court’s holdings in Commonwealth v. Mincavage, 945 A.2d 233 (Pa.Super.2008), and in the present case, in direct conflict with the Rules of Criminal Procedure and Rules of Appellate Procedure, specifically Pa.R.Crim.P. 720 and 721 and Pa.R.A.P 1701 and 3304?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Petitioner v. Michael COOPER, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Dec. 29, 2009.
